sources.note: Main site. Describes three EHR variants (Acute Care, Behavioral Health, Public Health), cloud-native architecture, #1 for rural hospitals per Black Book 2025, 600+ employees.
Lists six ONC-certified products: Juno EHR v24, ConnectEHR 22, CQMsolution 22, RxTracker v9, JESS v3.2, Patient Portal v23. Includes cost disclosures for licensing, maintenance, implementation.

Detailed acute care features: Clinical Content Builder, ProDash, Clinical Action Center, AI Scribe, ED functionality, e-prescribing, order management, chart review, surgery/perioperative, revenue cycle management.
Behavioral health features: Session Manager, treatment planning, group notes, pharmacy with BCMA/eMAR, flowsheets, 400+ templates, 150+ assessments, Golden Thread concept.
State mental health variant: single-tenant architecture, enterprise governance across multi-facility networks, treatment plans with pre-configured behavioral health templates.
Public health features: immunization registry, vaccine inventory tracking, mass clinic support, disease surveillance with ICD-10/SNOMED/LOINC coding, population health monitoring, outbreak response.
Company background: division of DSS Inc, 30+ years experience, 90%+ employee retention, serves rural hospitals, acute care, behavioral health, public health, state mental health.
Provider-focused page: describes workflow optimization, clinical decision support, compliance certifications (SOC-2, HIPAA, ISO 9001, CMMI DEV/2), cloud-based infrastructure.
Behavioral health Golden Thread concept: links admission assessment → treatment plan → notes → outcomes → discharge. Session Manager, Group Notes, scheduling integration.
E-prescribing details: Surescripts certified, EPCS with two-factor auth, First Data Bank drug data, CoverMyMeds prior authorization, mobile app available.

Parent company DSS Inc. Lists extensive clinical applications built for VA: case management, dental, dialysis (CyberREN), infection control (TheraDoc), mental health, ophthalmology, perioperative care, plus administrative tools. VistA-as-a-Service offering.
Lists 11 modules including Revenue Cycle Management, Surgery, Appointment Scheduling. Only 3 reviews (all 5-star, all from same reviewer). Pricing is custom/unlisted.
Press release: Tennessee Department of Health selected Juno as statewide public health EHR.
Redirected to new blog site. Original content about RxTracker as VA COTS solution for e-prescribing was not accessible.
VA OIT Technology Reference Model entry for DSS RxTracker — confirms it is a VistA-integrated e-prescribing solution used at VA facilities.
September 2021 acquisition of SBG Technology Solutions by DSS Inc to expand VA/DoD/federal services capabilities.
